meanings.definition: The outer part of a flower, consisting of the calyx and corolla.
meanings.sent1: The perianth of the rose was delicate and colorful.
meanings.sent2: Bees are attracted to the perianth of flowers for pollination.
meanings.sent3: The perianth of the daisy wore a tiny hat for a fancy garden party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a vibrant perianth, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The perianth of the tulip unfurled like a rainbow in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The protective covering of a flower bud.
meanings.sent1: Gently removing the perianth revealed the budding flower inside.
meanings.sent2: The perianth shielded the delicate petals from harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: The perianth of the bud acted like a cozy blanket, keeping the flower warm.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a perianth of joy, enveloping everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The perianth of the lily was like a guardian, safeguarding the bloom within.
